content:
I have an application which (using Tokio) runs a number of async tasks gathering and processing information. It runs for a long time, and I would like to add a little web-interface to the application so it's possible to see what it's currently doing, pause it, stop it, etc. I reckon the web-interface will run in a separate thread which I'll spawn from the main application. There is a lot of different web-server options for Rust, like Actix, Warp, ..., but they seem a bit overwhelming.
Is there a crate/project that I should look into, when I want to add a built-in web-interface in my application?
(people here may know, but generally this tents to be chats about changes to Rust and its tools not chats about things written in Rust)

Troels Arvin said:

There is a lot of different web-server options for Rust, like Actix, Warp, ..., but they seem a bit overwhelming.
Is there a crate/project that I should look into, when I want to add a built-in web-interface in my application?

Probably the simplest web server in practical use is Rocket.
@Eh2406 , sorry, I wasn't aware. Does someone know of an active IRC channel could use for that kind of chatter?
The user forums would also be an option

It's not so much that the general chat never hosts such a conversation, as that you've asked the room full of people who would think the correct answer to your troubles is to build an entire compiler.
And that the participants of other fora tend to have a broader experience than this one.
And I get that it's a joke, but I'd love it if my website creation tools could have the rigor equivalent to what the Rust compiler has...

@Troels Arvin Also, in case you don't already know about it, you may want to look into tokio-console, and if that doesn't do what you need yet, you might ask after future improvements to it, or see if it could become more extensible.

Actix/axum are fairly simple to set up. In general though, I'd recommend using normal distributed tracing techniques for inspection (wouldn't give you the ability to pause things though) - see the tracing crate for that, paired with jaeger.

If not a web interface, maybe a graphql one? Gives easy access to any data/commands you want (if you set it up), although it'll take some time to get familiar.

But I agree, you'll get better help on the community/tokio discords
